instruction: Display the top 5 CPU consuming processes
Find the process ID listening on port 8080
Kill all processes owned by user 'guest'
Set priority of process 1234 to high/nice -10
windows_cmd: wmic process where processid=1234 call setpriority 128

instruction: Kill a process tree starting at PID 1234

windows_cmd: echo Windows does not have zombie processes in the Unix sense.

instruction: List processes sorted by memory usage

windows_cmd: echo Windows CMD does not support POSIX signals directly.

instruction: Count how many 'chrome' processes are running
Start a long-running script in the background
Check how long process 1234 has been running
windows_cmd: wmic process where processid=1234 get creationdate

instruction: Run 'ps aux' every 2 seconds to monitor processes
Kill processes running for more than 1 hour
mac: ps -eo pid,etime | grep -E '([0-9]{2}-|([0-9]{2}:){2})' | awk '{print $1}' | xargs kill

instruction: Find the parent PID of process 1234
windows_cmd: wmic process where processid=1234 get parentprocessid

linux: ps -eo pid,pcpu,pmem --sort=-pmem | head -2 | tail -1 | awk '{print $1}' | xargs kill

windows_cmd: wmic path win32_thread where ProcessHandle=1234 list brief

instruction: Show the full command line used to start process 1234
windows_cmd: wmic process where processid=1234 get commandline

instruction: Run a command limited to 50% CPU usage
Run a command that keeps running after logout
windows_cmd: start /b script.bat (Windows services are better for this)

instruction: Kill a process by clicking on its window (interactive)
mac: Force Quit via UI or 'killall appname'

windows_cmd: wmic process where processid=1234 get commandline (limited env access)

instruction: Kill the entire process group of PID 1234
Start a process with low priority
Force a core dump of process 1234
Find the executable path of process 1234
windows_cmd: wmic process where processid=1234 get ExecutablePath

instruction: Kill all processes owned by the current user
Bring the last background job to the foreground
windows_cmd: echo CMD does not support job control like bash.

instruction: Set process 1234 to run only on CPU Core 0
windows_cmd: wmic process where processid=1234 call setaffinity 1
mac: echo macOS does not support affinity setting easily via CLI.

instruction: Kill all applications that are not responding
Get the PID of the 'sshd' service
Send TERM signal, wait 5s, then send KILL
Start a new session for a process
Run a command for maximum 10 seconds
Check what process is holding a lock on 'file.txt'
Kill users who have been idle for more than 30 minutes
Monitor system calls count for a process
Disown a process from the shell so it survives logout
Run a command in a new root directory
windows_cmd: echo Windows does not support chroot.
